## Problem 3.32b
```{r}
n <- 700   
u <- 160 
lambda = n/u
bowls <- rep(0,u)  

for (i in 1:n)
{
	i <- sample(1:u,1)  
	bowls[i] <- bowls[i] + 1   
}

bowls  
table(bowls)  

round(dpois(0:max(bowls),lambda)*u,2)

print ("P between 3 and 6 cells simulate")
sum(table(bowls)[3:6]) /160
print ("P between 3 and 6 based on Poisson mode")
```


#Problem 3.43
```{r}
n <- 500   
u <- 100  
lambda = n/u


bowls <- rep(0,u)  

for (i in 1:n)
{
	i <- sample(1:u,1) 
	bowls[i] <- bowls[i] + 1 
}


table(bowls)  

sum(bowls%%2==1) /u
sum(bowls%%2==0) /u

odds <- 1:round(max(bowls)/2)*2-1
sum(round(dpois(0:max(bowls),lambda)*u,2)[odds])/100
value <- (1 - exp(-2*lambda)) / 2
value
```
